article_title: Time to Act on North Korean Nuclear Threat
article_text:
Whether North Korea tested a hydrogen bomb or an “ordinary” nuclear fission device, the basic truth remains the same—North Korea has crossed the nuclear threshold and is never going back. At this point, the only acceptable response is to beef up our ballistic-missile defenses so Pyongyang’s nukes cannot put American cities at risk (”The New Nuclear Proliferation Age,” Review & Outlook, Jan. 7).

article_summary:
Whether North Korea tested a hydrogen bomb or an “ordinary” nuclear fission device, the basic truth remains the same—North Korea has crossed the nuclear threshold and is never going back.
Our existing Ground-based Midcourse Defense missile-defense system (GMD) provides a vital foundation for this effort.
At this point, the only acceptable response is to beef up our ballistic-missile defenses so Pyongyang’s nukes cannot put American cities at risk (”The New Nuclear Proliferation Age,” Review & Outlook, Jan. 7).
